III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10157 Health services; policies and
Section procedures.
Description Health services; policies and procedures
(1) A facility shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures that address all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical and dental care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A's testicles have been hurting for the past two weeks. An
unknown nurse only gave Youth A Tylenol, and a medical exam
was neglected to be given to him. When Youth A was finally seen
by a doctor on 05/23/2025, Youth A had to be sent to the
emergency department due to there being no blood flow and
Youth A's testicles were necrotic. Youth A needs to now have
surgery on 05/24/20225, to have his testicles removed. Medical
staff have noted this could have been avoidable if Youth A was
brought in prior.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 5/29/2025. He reported being aware of
the situation with Youth A and Administrator 2 was informed of the
situation prior to Administrator 1 being informed. He reported
Nurse has been suspended from duties until this investigation is
completed. Nurse will not be at the facility as part of the
suspension. He reported Nurse is the individual who makes the
decision if a youth needs hospitalization and if Nurse is not
available, administration will make the decision. He reported
Nurse did not see Youth A as presenting with a medical
emergency. Administrator 1 reported observing and speaking with
2

Youth A in the school classroom between 5/14/25 and 5/23/25
(unable to identify specific day) and Youth A never mentioned
having any pain or medical issues.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face with MDHHS
Worker at the facility on 5/29/2025. He reported having Nurse’s
notes covering the time from 5/14/25 to 5/23/25 and will provide
copies of the notes. He reported on 5/14/25 or 5/15/25, having
Youth A approach Administrator 2 and saying he was in pain to
which Administrator 2 contacted Nurse. He reported Youth A
refused to be examined by Nurse even when a male staff was
offered to be present. He reported understanding Youth A had
informed Nurse that he was feeling better with no pain. He
reported Youth A would approach Administrator 2 almost every
other day to say he was in pain and pain relief and ice was offered
but Youth A continued to refuse any medical help. The Monday
before Youth A went to the hospital, he was engaged in playing
basketball and Nurse informed Administrator 2 that if it was
serious, Youth A would not be engaged in playing basketball. On
Tuesday of that week, Youth A reported having pain and on
Wednesday, Youth A reported it was hurting more, that Friday,
Youth A was taken to the medical bus where the treating
physician (Med Bus Physician) indicated Youth A needs to be
seen at the hospital. Administrator 2 believes part of the delay is
the facility had just experienced a “rash of youth wanting Nurse to
check their private areas” and it appeared to be an effort to
manipulate Nurse. He reported if Nurse had told staff to take
Youth A to the hospital, administration would back this action
completely. Administrator 2 reported there has been no discipline
with Nurse since she began her employment at the facility. He
reported Nurse informed him that Youth A had told her, Youth A
hurt his private area when he bumped against the sink in the
bedroom.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with the
MDHHS Worker on 5/29/2025. Youth A reported the pain began
about 2 weeks ago and was caused after playing basketball.
Youth A reported telling Nurse the next day and receiving pain
medication. Youth A reported the pain increased the following day
and Youth A told Nurse Youth A needed to be placed on the
medical bus and taken to the hospital because Youth A had pain
in his groin area. Youth A reported getting on the medical bus the
next Friday (medical bus only comes every other Friday) and
being taken to the hospital after that. Youth A reported
complaining of the pain daily and never telling anyone he felt
better. Youth A reported some staff (unable to identify which staff)
3

would ask Youth A why Youth A is “walking that way”. Youth A
reported telling Staff 1 and Staff 4 about the pain and having them
tell Youth A to “get some rest” before they told Nurse. Youth A
identified telling Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, and Supervisor 3
about Youth A’s pain and reported they each said they would look
into it but “nothing ever happened”. Youth A reported Nurse told
Youth A a male staff can come in and check, but Youth A
declined. Youth A reported feeling safe at the facility but also
feeling neglected. The treatment program is helping Youth A make
changes and Youth A hopes to be released within 6-9 months.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with the
MDHHS Worker on 5/29/2025. He reported being told only once
by Youth A that Youth A had pain in Youth A’s groin area but was
unable to identify a specific day or date. Staff 1 informed Nurse of
this issue and Nurse responded by coming down to Youth A’s
room to check on Youth A. Staff 1 reported hearing (unable to
identify who told him) that Nurse asked to see the injury, but Youth
A refused Nurse. Staff 1 reported having no knowledge of the
cause of Youth A’s injury.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with the
MDHHS Worker on 6/3/2025. She reported first receiving a call
from Youth A on 5/14/25 and when arriving to Youth A’s room,
Youth A informed her Youth A’s “balls hurt”. She reported Youth A
had difficulty explaining the type of pain, so she went through a
series of questions. Youth A reported not touching himself and
there was no specific aggravation of Youth A’s “balls”. Youth A
told Nurse, Youth A believes he bumped himself while sleeping.
Because Youth A refused Nurse to examine his groin, Nurse
provided pain medication and ice. The next day (5/15/25), Nurse
reported receiving another call that Youth A was having chest
pains, so Youth A was removed from his room, and she began
checking Youth A’s vitals but Youth A then informed Nurse, Youth
A’s “balls” hurt, not Youth A’s chest. Nurse reported Youth A
asked to go to the hospital and Nurse reported “I don’t just send
kids to the hospital”. She asked to examine Youth A’s testicles
with a male staff present and Youth A declined. She reported
doing a google search into the symptoms that Youth A described
(twisting balls) and what she found didn’t match what Youth A was
describing. She found that if Youth A had “twisting balls”, Youth A
would not be able to walk. She reported getting feedback about
“blue balls” from Administrator 2 and Administrator 3, but this also
didn’t match what Youth A was reporting because it was caused
by masturbating and Youth A denied doing so. She reported
Youth A kept saying he wanted to go to the hospital and Nurse
4

spoke to Supervisor 3 about this and Supervisor 3 went to speak
with Youth A. Nurse reported she “can’t just send Youth A to the
hospital for bumping his testicles in his sleep” since he has not
been examined. Nurse reported leaving work for a couple of days
with the assumption that Youth A would have been taken to the
hospital if the condition worsen. When she returned to work on
5/16/25 she reported observing Youth A laughing with peers and
only asking for tums as the only medical interaction that day. She
reported a belief that the issue was resolved at that time, because
of Youth A’s laughing and having no pain. Nurse reported on
5/17/25 she came in on Saturday and observed Youth A playing
basketball and interacting with others. Youth A never called Nurse
that day and didn’t report any pain. Nurse reported overhearing
Youth A speak to his mother during a phone call and discussing
something about “balls and hospital”. Nurse reported telling Youth
A to stop being silly and to leave his mother alone. She believed
Youth A was joking with his mother. Nurse reported returning to
work after two days off on 5/20/25 and when passing medication
to another youth on the pod, having Youth A ask for pain
medication because of a headache. She reported Youth A said he
still has testicle pain and asked when Nurse was going to take him
to the hospital. Nurse reported telling Youth A she can’t take him
to the hospital without doing an examination. Later that day
(5/20/2025), Nurse observed Youth A walking and shifting his
weight while walking. She reported Youth A was smiling so she
was “not sure what to make of it”. On the same day, she reported
a pencil was missing from the classroom Youth A attended so this
resulted in all the youth being lined up for a body search for the
pencil. Nurse reported Youth A was in the front of the line for the
search so she believed that finally someone would be able to
make an observation of Youth A’s testicles. She reported being
surprised when no one contacted her later about what they
observed when searching Youth A and Youth A never asked for
medical care the rest of the day. Nurse found out after Youth A
was taken to the hospital, that Youth A was never searched
because he was taken out of line for a court hearing and while at
court, the pencil was found so the search was called off. Following
the court hearing, Nurse reported receiving an email from
Probation Officer that Youth A stated in court he had a medical
problem that was not being addressed. She reported responding
to Probation Officer that she knew something about Youth A
bumping himself or masturbating as the cause. Probation Officer
told Nurse, Youth A may have “twisted ball” as the cause.
Probation Officer informed Nurse that when visiting Youth A, he
found Youth A “touching himself with Youth A’s hand down Youth
A’s pants while smiling. Nurse believed this supported her belief
5

that it was not a real medical issue because of the laughing,
joking, and activities Youth A was engaged in. Nurse reported
Administrator 2 informed her to have Youth A seen on the medical
bus because Youth A brought this issue up during the court
hearing, so she placed his name on the medical bus. Nurse
reported Youth A was seen on the medical bus on 5/23/25
(medical bus comes every 2 weeks on a Friday). Youth A was
displaying no signs of distress and was laughing and joking while
on the bus. After the examination by the doctor on the bus, it was
determined that Youth A needed surgery immediately which
caused Nurse to “panic” and she informed Supervisor 6 (who was
present) that Youth A needs to go to the hospital immediately.
Youth A was taken to the hospital by Staff 2 but was laughing and
joking the whole time. Nurse reported asking Youth A why he
didn’t want to be examined with a male staff present and Youth A
told her that Youth A now gets it. Nurse reported telling Youth A
she was proud Youth A told the truth. Nurse reported not seeing
Youth A again until his release from the hospital. Nurse was asked
about the delay in treatment for Youth A and how she made this
decision. Nurse reported once she found out the seriousness of
Youth A’s condition, he received medical care in 15-minutes. She
reported not recommending medical care because Youth A kept
refusing to be examined and had a history of lying about things,
his emotional presentation of laughing and joking around, and
playing basketball. She believed he had been searched prior to
going to court but found out after the medical bus examination that
Youth A had not been searched. Nurse reported examining Youth
A with a male staff present, post operation and everything looked
fine. Nurse was asked what she would have done differently, and
she reported she would have asked for an examination again and
asked if another staff, other than Administrator 3, would work for
Youth A. She reported she would not have listened to the male
staff about the condition and possible cause.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with the
MDHHS Worker on 6/3/2025. She reported being the staff
providing supervision for Youth A when he was taken to the
hospital. She reported having no forehand knowledge about the
situation with Youth A because she was on vacation, but did see
Youth A the day before the medical bus and hospital. She asked
Youth A why he was walking funny and Youth A told her he was
injured but didn’t know how. She reported Youth A told her he
began to experience pain but didn’t say anything right away
because he believed the pain would stop. She reported Youth A
said it was a couple of days before saying something to staff,
supervisors, or Nurse. She reported Youth A told her the first staff
6

he told was Staff 1 who acknowledged being told. She reported
Youth A was in “good spirits” while in the hospital and didn’t act
like he was in pain.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with
the MDHHS Worker on 6/3/2025. She reported the only issue
she witnessed was when she was passing medication with Staff 4
and Youth A was lying on his mat on the floor. Youth A acted like
it was trouble to get up, but she was unable to recall what Youth A
said to her. She did offer to get Youth A some pain relief if
needed. She was unable to recall his response. She believes this
may have occurred on 5/18/25. She reported Staff 4 informed her
that earlier in the day, Youth A was up for activities and not
struggling to move. Supervisor 1 reported having no concerns with
Nurse responding to medical issues when called and she is able
to call Nurse after hours if needed and Nurse will respond. She
reported Nurse is new at the facility and receives many calls from
the youth. Supervisor 1 described Youth A as a youth who has
had many concerns and seeks much attention. It is hard to tell if
Youth A is being “truthful and genuine”.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with
the MDHHS Worker on 6/3/2025. He reported limited interactions
with Youth A but never heard Youth A asking for the Nurse during
these interactions. He reported the interactions took place mostly
when Supervisor 2 was passing medication. Supervisor 2 was
present during the strip search for the missing pencil and reported
that while Youth A was in a zoom call for court (would have been
searched if they left the facility for in-person court) the pencil was
found and the strip search ended. He reported there was no
indication that Youth A should have been searched for anything
else like a medical condition.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility with the
MDHHS Worker on 6/3/2025. He reported not knowing specific
information about Youth A other than Youth A was moved from
detention to treatment within the facility. He reported the process if
a youth reports being hurt or in pain is to notify the supervisor or
Nurse. He reported hearing Youth A went to the hospital but had
no details. He reported no concerns about Nurse and believes she
is proactive and attends to the youth right away. He reported not
observing Youth A with any issues and watched Youth A play
basketball and “never sit out a game”. There was never any sign
of discomfort or issues in the way Youth A walked.
7

Complainant was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS
Worker on 6/3/2025. She reported the facility is now sharing
information about Youth A with her. She reported first becoming
aware of Youth A’s pain when Youth A told the lawyer who told
the judge, and this occurred a week before the hospital. She
reported a belief that Youth A wanted to be alone with Nurse and
no one believed Youth A because of the smiling and joking. She
reported Youth A didn’t mind if Nurse looked at his privates but
didn’t want a male staff to look.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS
Worker on 6/3/2025. She reported working on 5/14/25 and
observing Youth A in the bedroom where Youth A didn’t complain
of any pain. She reported a half hour later, Nurse reported Youth
A complained of pain but refused to allow a male staff to assist
with the examination of the painful area. She reported Staff 7
wrote an incident report about observing Youth A engage in
masturbation when doing a room check on 5/14/25. She reported
never hearing Youth A request to be taken to the hospital and has
a history of faking illness. She reported observing Youth A
laughing and joking after 5/14/25 but also noticed Youth A was
walking with Youth A’s legs further apart but never telling
Supervisor 3 he was in pain. She reported Youth A continued to
play basketball and engage in different activities, acting normal.
She reported because she has no medical knowledge, she was
following Nurse’s judgement.
Hospital Social Worker was interviewed via phone with the
MDHHS Worker on 6/10/2025. She reported being told by Youth
A at the hospital that the injury to Youth A’s testicles occurred
while playing basketball at the facility. She reported Youth A told
her a male nurse examined Youth A at the facility. She reported
being informed that Youth A refused medical treatment on 5/14/25
because the nurse was female, and it is documented in the
surgery note that Youth A has had pain for 2 weeks at the time of
surgery.
Surgery Physician was interviewed via phone with the
MDHHS Worker on 6/10/2025. She reported being told by Youth
A the pain has been going on for about a week and Youth A never
told anyone about the pain for a “day or two”. Youth A informed
her that he didn’t want to be examined by Nurse at the facility
because she was female and needed to wait for a male nurse.
Surgery Physician reported once the blood flow is disrupted, there
was only 6 hours before the testicle would be lost, and the pain
can be severe. She reported that it is difficult to diagnose the
8

injury without being able to actually examine Youth A, and unsure
if an exam could be forced. She reported it is hard to determine
the level of injury if Youth A was still playing basketball and hard
to determine pain tolerance from youth to youth. She reported it
would be reasonable to wait a couple of days in the beginning but
once a few days had gone by and Youth A sill complained of pain,
walked “funny”, and had limited activity, Nurse probably should
have reached out to a medical provider. She reported if the right
testicle is functioning, Youth A will still be able to father children.
She reported the stories from Youth A and others, appear
inconsistent and it would have been difficult to diagnosis if no
examination took place, and he was still engaged in sports like
basketball.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS Worker on
6/13/2025. Staff 4 reported working with Youth A and “about a
month ago”, when having Youth A get up for a phone call, noticing
Youth A walking “funny”. Youth A was lying on a mattress on the
floor of the bedroom when Staff 4 came into the room to get Youth
A up. Youth A informed Staff 4 that Youth A had “pain down there”
pointing to Youth A’s groin area. Staff 4 reported telling Supervisor
1 about Youth A stating having pain in the groin area. Staff 4
reported Youth A was in his room most of the time between May
14 and May 23, 2025.
Staff 7 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS Worker on
6/13/2025. Staff 7 reported working with Youth A on 5/14/25 and
when making room checks noticed Youth A was naked laying on a
mattress on the floor and masturbating. After doing the visual
check, Staff 7 walked away and later wrote an incident report.
Staff 7 reported Youth A didn’t appear to be in pain and did not
mention any thing about pain. Staff 7 reported Youth A was
walking normal prior to 5/14/25. Staff 7 reported Youth A was in
the room because Youth A was on a modified room program for
having contraband in his room. Three to four days later, Staff 7
reported not knowing the day (believed it was sometime around
5/16/25-5/17/25) but Youth A did report having pain sometime
after 5/14/25. Therefore, Staff 7 called Nurse. Nurse told Staff 7
that Youth A was fine. Staff 7 believed Youth A was in pain
because of the way Youth A was walking and Nurse made it
sound like Youth A was looking for a way to get out of the facility
so Staff 7 “went with Nurse because Staff 7 has no medical
training”.
Physician 1 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS
Worker on 6/13/2025. She reported being a physician in the
9

Emergency Room when Youth A was admitted. She reported
Youth A said he was hurt about 2 weeks prior to the Emergency
Room visit. Physician 1 reported within the first 24-48 hours of a
testicle being twisted, the person would be in a lot of pain but once
the testicle dies, the pain goes away and there is only discomfort
from the swelling. She reported normally working with individuals
when they are experiencing the pain of the twisting.
Physician 2 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS
Worker on 6/13/2025. Physician 2 reported providing care to
Youth A when Youth A was brought to the Emergency Room on
5/23/25. He reported Youth A informed Physician 2 that Youth A
was hurt playing basketball 2 weeks prior and feeling pain from
the injury. Youth A informed Physician 2 that Youth A waited to
see if this became better before going to Nurse but not saying how
long Youth A waited (hours or days). Youth A stated Nurse tried
to examine Youth A, but Youth A refused, and the pain was on
and off, but Youth A still played basketball.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone with the MDHHS Worker on
6/16/2025. He first noticed Youth A limping on a Friday or
Saturday but was unable to recall the specific date. He reported
asking Youth A about the limp and having Youth A respond saying
“something about his testicles” and Youth A asked Staff 5 to call
Nurse. Staff 5 reported informing Supervisor 3 and Nurse. Staff 5
reported Youth A asked more than once to see Nurse and each
time asking, Staff 5 would contact Nurse and let her know. Staff 5
reported taking Youth A to the gym and telling Youth A not to play
basketball because Youth A appeared to be in pain, but Staff 5
believed Youth A played basketball at times after. Staff 5 reported
Youth A never told Staff 5 how Youth A injured himself and Staff 5
described Youth A as a “strong kid” who has played basketball
with a hurt ankle in the past. Staff 5 reported Youth A informed
Staff 5 that a male staff was going to check Youth A’s injury and
Nurse was also going to examine the injury.
Documents Reviewed:
Email from Nurse dated 6/6/25. Nurse documents as the
purpose of this email is to add additional information to her
interview on 6/3/25. Nurse reported the rule for youth asking for
pain medication changed while she was off work. Nurse reported
receiving an email of the policy change because she had been
asking for assistance with the frequency of passing medication to
youth. Nurse reported the new policy involves any youth that asks
any staff member for Tylenol or Ibuprofen, will be locked in their
10

room as out of program (OOP) sick until the nurse is notified to
evaluate/clear that resident. She reported having several youth
angry with her because of this change and having the youth state
they are not asking for pain medication because they don’t want to
be in their rooms. Nurse reported a belief that because of this new
policy and Youth A serving a 5-day room suspension, Youth A
avoided asking for pain medication because Youth A didn’t want
to spend more time in his room. Nurse reported reviewing the
medication logs and finding that Youth A asked night shift staff for
pain medication on 5/15/25, 5/16/25, and 5/17/25 and the policy of
OOP Sick was not enforced for Youth A. This caused Nurse not to
be notified and Youth A was not evaluated by Nurse. Nurse
reported other youth who asked for pain medication were placed
on OOP SICK and had to be cleared by her. Nurse reported not
agreeing with the new policy, but if it stands then it should “be fair
for all youth”.
Email from PhD dated 6/12/25. PhD reported having no contact
with Youth A on 5/14/25 or 5/23/25 and has no concerns
regarding potential child abuse and/or neglect. PhD reported
having no concerns about the care and safety of all youth in the
facility. PhD reported Youth A has social reciprocity,
communication issues, rigid thinking patterns, and interception
difficulties (i.e., challenges in recognizing and understanding
bodily sensations).

Incident Report Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home for Youth
A at 10:50 am dated 5/13/25. This incident is described as staff
finding contraband (pen) in Youth A’s room. The disciplinary
action authorized is a modified Pod Program with 1 hour of
activity. It is also documented that Youth A admitted to taking the
pen from a classroom last week. This report was written by Staff
6.
Incident Report Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home for Youth
A at 2:00 pm dated 5/14/25. The incident is described as Staff 7
was passing out information to each youth in their rooms, when
approaching Youth A’s room, Staff 7 observed Youth A “laid out
touching himself”. This document was signed off by Supervisor 3
on 5/14/25.
Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 4.7 Resident
Management/Resident Rights with no date. This document
outlines that medical care shall be provided for all youth and no
youth shall be denied access to a licensed physician upon
request.
Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home Policy 7.12 Emergency
Procedures with no date. This document outlines the procedures
for medical emergencies. The first action step is for staff to
determine the nature of the injury in as much detail as possible.
The second action step involves staff notifying appropriate
12

medical personnel or emergency medical ambulance services.
The third action step If the youth can move, the youth should be
assisted to appropriate medical services. Fourth action step is if
the youth can’t be moved, emergency medical services should be
brought to the youth. The fifth action step involves notifying the
Superintendent and documenting the incident on an incident
report. The final action step is to call 911.

Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as evidenced by interviews
with staff, youth, and documentation reviewed. Evidence indicates
Nurse delayed medical treatment to Youth A because of a belief
Youth A was not being truthful about his claim of an injury. Nurse
appears to have based her belief on observing Youth A playing
basketball, laughing, joking, giggling, and having a history of
medication seeking behaviors. An additional factor is Youth A’s
refusal to be examined when it was offered twice. Nurse sought
advice from non-medically trained staff (Administrator 2 and
Administrator 3) rather than seeking a second opinion from
another medical professionals. She also conducted a “Google”
search for information. This led to a lack of medical care for Youth
A. It should be noted there is a strong suspicion that Youth A’s lost
function of his testicle occurred because evidence supports Youth
A did not inform Nurse or other staff within the 6-hour window to
save the testicle once it was twisted. Therefore, the lack of
medical care did not occur until after the loss of the testicle. Youth
A gave several possible causes of the injury which seems to
change depending on who Youth A is speaking with.
